title: Food argument leaves 2 brothers dead, 1 wounded in Hudson
content:
Hudson, Florida -- An argument over food led a 13-year-old to shoot two of his brothers, leaving a 6-year-old dead and a 16-year-old wounded on Wednesday night. The 13-year-old then killed himself.
The shooting was reported about 6:19 p.m. in the area of 16000 block of Bachmann Avenue in the Sugar Lane Mobile Home Park, according to Pasco Sheriff Chris Nocco.
"This one's a nightmare," said Nocco. "This is tough on us as law enforcement This is tough on the community.
"I ask our community for prayers."
The boys were at home eating dinner when an argument started over food.
The 13-year-old got a handgun, shot and killed his 6-year-old brother, shot the 16-year-old, and then shot himself, according to the sheriff's office.
The 16-year-old then called 911 about 6:19 p.m..
Nocco added that the information was preliminary.
The shooting also shocked neighbors.
"I don't understand it. It doesn't make any sense," says one woman.
The sheriff said five people live in the house, a mother and her four boys. The mother was at work and an 18-year-old son was not at home.
"We talk about to many tragic situations. This is a nightmare," says Nocco. "This is a nightmare, especially when hear ages."
Nocco said deputies are working to find out who owned the gun.
Nocco says the mother of the boys and the 18-year-old brother were at the hospital late Wednesday with the 16-year-old as he recovers.
The schools that the two deceased boys attended have been notified and will have grief counselors available for students as the identity of these boys are revealed.
